bb5d0993-b435-45ab-903a-5e4df6bbdec4.description: Earners of Navigating Extraordinary Times have developed self-awareness and leadership skills to effectively lead during exceptional times, such as the COVID-19 pandemic. They have evaluated present conditions, considered ways to pivot business practices that are no longer working, and use a design thinking framework to explore new, innovative opportunities. Earners have developed empathy, communication, and leadership skills to support the health and well-being of their teams and themselves.
bb5d0993-b435-45ab-903a-5e4df6bbdec4.name: Navigating Extraordinary Times

issuer.summary: issued by PowerED™ by Athabasca University

badge_template_activities.title: Engaged in content, videos, and digital learning interactions

52f417ab-93e6-45f3-8762-e992673e1853.description: Earners of Project Execution can execute projects using project plans in both Agile and traditional project management environments, and can effectively manage resources for each project. They can use tools to identify risks and impacts, effectively request changes when necessary, and efficiently close-out projects.
52f417ab-93e6-45f3-8762-e992673e1853.name: Project Execution

issuer.summary: issued by PowerED™ by Athabasca University

alignments.name: Project Management Institute - PMBOK® Guide & Standards
alignments.description: Alignment to the most recent version of the Project Management Institute's A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide)

alignments.name: Project Management Institute - PMP®
alignments.description: The required courses of the Project Management Certificate align with the body of knowledge necessary to sit for the Project Management Professional (PMP®) exam

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of assignments, including procurement of resources, change management documents, project milestones, and a briefing document of final deliverables
Completion of weekly discussions and quizzes

6ae4a385-4bc3-44d7-a960-f669115ea227.description: Earners of Project Launch are able to justify and select projects, identify requirements to define project scope, create effective communication plans, and assign responsibilities. They can establish project requirements, use scheduling software, and create a formal project plan.
6ae4a385-4bc3-44d7-a960-f669115ea227.name: Project Launch

issuer.summary: issued by PowerED™ by Athabasca University

alignments.name: Project Management Institute - PMP®
alignments.description: The required courses of the Project Management Certificate align with the body of knowledge necessary to sit for the Project Management Professional (PMP®) exam

badge_template_activities.title: Complete assignments, including the creation of a Project Charter, Statement of Work, Workback Schedule, Stakeholder Management Plan, and  Communications Plan
Completion of weekly discussions and quizzes

89954226-5ae9-4490-865a-00f416e641dd.description: Earners of the Project Management Certificate have applied fundamental project management principles, theories, and practices to case studies, discussions, and their own places of work. They are able to launch, plan, and execute a project from start to finish, managing stakeholder expectations and driving high performing teams.
89954226-5ae9-4490-865a-00f416e641dd.name: Project Management Certificate

issuer.summary: issued by PowerED™ by Athabasca University

alignments.name: Project Management Institute - PMP®

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the first course in Project Management Certificate - Project Launch
Complete the second course in Project Management Certificate - Project Planning
Complete the third course in Project Management Certificate - Project Execution
Complete the fourth course in Project Management Certificate - Project Practicum With Multiple Projects

cb26a0bd-5aa2-46fe-ad1f-bcc6c9640de1.description: Earners of Project Planning can create network diagrams, estimate project time, differentiate between effort and duration, determine critical path, calculate float, and define milestones. They are able to create a project schedule, estimate resources, perform basic risk assessments, and develop quality metrics to assess a project.
cb26a0bd-5aa2-46fe-ad1f-bcc6c9640de1.name: Project Planning

issuer.summary: issued by PowerED™ by Athabasca University

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of assignments, including a Supplier Selection Matrix, Risk Management Plan, Reources Report, and Project Schedule
Completion of weekly discussions and quizzes

2046080e-a913-43fb-a3e1-0725397c3855.description: Earners of Project Practicum With Multiple Projects are able to create stakeholder maps, a resource utilization plan, and a master project schedule for multiple projects. They can develop a master communication plan, risk register, and lessons learned.
2046080e-a913-43fb-a3e1-0725397c3855.name: Project Practicum With Multiple Projects
